biography.content: Eloise Carr joined the University of Calgary in October 2011 as full Professor, in the Faculty of Nursing, University of Calgary, Alberta in Canada. A nurse by background, she is strongly committed to improving pain management through collaborative practice where professionals can work and learn together to improve patient care.  Her pain research uses mixed methods (quantitative and qualitative approaches) to explore chronic/persistent pain and interprofessional education. In particular, she is interested in the barriers to effective pain management and knowledge translation (KT) related to pain management. Eloise holds a 0.5 appointment as Associate Dean (Students) in the Faculty of Graduate Studies, University of Calgary.
